technique1.name: The Feynman Technique
technique1.explaination: A method of learning and retaining information by explaining it in simple terms.

technique2.name: The Cornell Method
technique2.explaination: A note-taking method that involves dividing a page into sections for notes, cues, and a summary.

technique3.name: SQ3R Method
technique3.explaination: A method of studying that involves Surveying, Questioning, Reading, Reciting and Reviewing.

technique4.name: Mind Mapping
technique4.explaination: A visual method of organizing information by connecting ideas with branches and sub-branches.

technique5.name: Flashcards
technique5.explaination: A method of studying that involves creating cards with information on them and reviewing them.

technique6.name: Active Recall
technique6.explaination: A method of studying that involves actively trying to remember information.

technique7.name: Spaced Repetition
technique7.explaination: A method of studying that involves reviewing information at increasing intervals to improve retention.

technique8.name: The Leitner System
technique8.explaination: A method of spaced repetition that involves sorting flashcards into different boxes based on how well you know the information.

technique9.name: Mnemonics
technique9.explaination: Memory aids that help you remember information by associating it with something else.

technique10.name: Visualization
technique10.explaination: A technique of creating mental images to help remember information

technique11.name: Elaborative Interrogation
technique11.explaination: A technique of generating explanations for why facts are true to help remember them.

technique12.name: Interleaving
technique12.explaination: A method of studying that involves switching between different topics or types of problems to improve retention

technique13.name: Deliberate Practice
technique13.explaination: A method of practicing that involves setting specific goals and focusing on improving weaknesses.

technique14.name: Retrieval Practice
technique14.explaination: A method of studying that involves actively trying to recall information from memory.
